title: Calories in One Onion
meta_description: Discover calories in one onion, including carbs, fiber, protein, and full nutrition breakdown per medium raw onion, plus variations and FAQs.
assumptions: Medium yellow onion (~110 g), raw, peeled; values based on USDA data.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by onion type, size, variety, and preparation method. Check labels or sources for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One medium raw onion provides about 44 kcal, mostly from carbs with good fiber content.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one medium onion?
faqs.a: About 44 kcal for a medium raw yellow onion (~110 g).

faqs.q: What are the carbs in one onion?
faqs.a: Roughly 10.3 g total carbs, including 1.9 g fiber and 4.7 g sugars.

faqs.q: Does cooking an onion change its calories?
faqs.a: Minimal change if no fat added; sautéing or caramelizing can add calories from oil or concentration.

faqs.q: How much protein is in one onion?
faqs.a: Only about 1.2 g protein per medium onion.
Yes, just 4 mg sodium per medium onion, making them suitable for low-sodium diets.
